snippet: The changes, spurred in part by a recent investigation by The New York Times, will help remove a “veil of secrecy” in high-end sales, a city official said.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration, in effort to increase transparency in luxury real estate market, imposes new disclosure requirements that calls for all members of shell companies buying or selling property be disclosed to the city; changes are spurred by recent investigation in New York Times.
lead_paragraph: The changes, spurred in part by a recent investigation by The New York Times, will help remove a “veil of secrecy” in high-end sales, a city official said.

headline.main: New Disclosure Rules for Shell Companies in New York Luxury Real Estate Sales
headline.print_headline: New Rules by de Blasio Administration Seek to Uncover Real Estate’s Real Owners

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Real Estate Board of New York
